ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying among the Sakyans at Kapilavatthu in Banyan Tree Monastery.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.1.2_0: At that time Mahānāma the Sakyan had an abundance of tonics.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.1.3_0: Then Mahānāma went up to the Buddha,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.1.3_2: and told him what he had thought,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.1.4_0: “Venerable Sir, I wish to invite the Sangha to ask for tonics from me for four months.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.1.7_0: Again the monks were afraid of wrongdoing and did not accept.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.1.8_0: They told the Buddha. He then had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.1.9_0: “Monks, I allow you to accept an invitation to supply tonics for four months.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.2.1_0: At that time the monks asked Mahānāma for a small amount of tonics.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.2.1_1: In the same way, Mahānāma the Sakyan has an abundance of tonics.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.2.2_2: and told him what he had thought,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.2.3_0: “Sir, I wish to invite the Sangha to ask for tonics from me for a further four months.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.2.6_0: Again the monks were afraid of wrongdoing and did not accept.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.2.7_0: They told the Buddha. He then had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.2.8_0: “Monks, I allow you to accept a further invitation.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.3.1_0: Once again the monks only asked Mahānāma for a small amount of tonics.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.3.1_1: In the same way, Mahānāma the Sakyan has an abundance of tonics.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.3.2_0: A third time he went to the Buddha,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.3.2_2: and told him what he had thought,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.3.3_0: “Sir, I wish to invite the Sangha to ask for tonics from me for life.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.3.6_0: Again the monks were afraid of wrongdoing and did not accept.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.3.7_0: They told the Buddha. He then had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.3.8_0: “Monks, I allow you to accept a permanent invitation.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.1_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were shabbily dressed and improper in appearance.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.2_0: And Mahānāma criticized them, “Venerables, why are you shabbily dressed and improper in appearance?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.3_0: Shouldn’t one gone forth be suitably dressed and proper in appearance?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.4_0: The monks from the group of six developed a grudge against Mahānāma.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.5_0: Thinking of ways to humiliate him, it occurred to me,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.6_0: “Mahānāma has invited the Sangha to ask for tonics.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.7_0: The monks from the group of six went up to Mahānāma,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.7_1: They then said to Mahānāma and said, “We need ghee.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.9_0: People have gone to the cow-pen to get ghee.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.10_0: You may come and get it tomorrow morning.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.12_0: and a third time the monks from the group of six said the same thing,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.14_0: People have gone to the cow-pen to get ghee.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.15_0: You may come and get it tomorrow morning.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.16_0: They then said, “Why do you give an invitation if you don’t wish to give?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.17_0: Mahānāma complained and criticized them, “How can they not wait for one day when asked?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.18_0: The monks heard the complaints of Mahānāma,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.19_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.20_0: “How can the monks from the group of six not wait for one day when asked by Mahānāma?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.21_0: “Is it true, monks, that you acted like this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.24_0: “... Foolish men, how can you not wait for one day when asked by Mahānāma?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.25_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.26_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.27.1_0: “A monk who is not sick may accept an invitation to ask for requisites for four months. They may accept a further invitation.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:1.4.27.1_1: If he accepts more than that, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.1_0: A monk who is not sick may accept an invitation to ask for requisites for four months:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.2_0: he may accept an invitation to ask for requisites for the sick.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.3_0: He may accept a further invitation:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.5_0: He may accept a permanent invitation:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.7_0: If he accepts one beyond that limit:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.8_0: there are invitations that have a limit on the tonics, but no limit on the time period;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.9_0: there are invitations that have a limit on the time period, but no limit on the tonics;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.10_0: there are invitations that have a limit on both the tonics and the time period;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.11_0: there are invitations that have a limit neither on the tonics nor on the time period.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.13_0: the tonics are restricted: “I invite you to ask for these particular tonics.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.15_0: the time period is restricted: “I invite you to ask during this particular period of time.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.16_0: Limit on both the tonics and the time period:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.17_0: both the tonics and the time period are restricted: “I invite you to ask for these particular tonics during this particular period of time.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.18_0: A limit neither on the tonics nor on the time period:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.19_0: neither the tonics nor the time period is restricted.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.20_0: When there is a limit on the tonics, if he asks for tonics other than those he has been invited to ask for, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.21_0: When there is a limit on the time period, if he asks outside of the period during which he has been invited to ask, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.22_0: When there is a limit on both the tonics and on the time period, if he asks for tonics other than those he has been invited to ask for and he asks outside of the period during which he has been invited to ask, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.1.23_0: When there is a limit neither on the tonics nor on the time period, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.2.1_0: If he asks for tonics when he has no need for tonics, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.2.2_0: If he asks for a tonic other than the tonic he needs, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.2.3.1_0: If it is beyond the limit, and he perceives it as such, and he asks for tonics, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.2.4_0: If it is beyond the limit, but he is unsure of it, and he asks for tonics, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.2.5_0: If it is beyond the limit, but he does not perceive it as such, and he asks for tonics, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.2.6_0: If it is not beyond the limit, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.2.7_0: If it is not beyond the limit, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.2.8_0: If it is not beyond the limit, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.3.2_0: if he asks for those tonics he was invited to ask for;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.3.3_0: if he asks during the time period that he was invited to ask;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.3.4_0: if he asks by informing, “You have invited me to ask for these tonics, but I need such-and-such a tonic;”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.3.5_0: if he asks by informing, “You have invited us to ask for these three times, but we need more;”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.3.7_0: if he asks those who have given an invitation;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.3.8_0: if he asks for the benefit of someone else;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.3.9_0: if it is by means of one’s own property;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc47:2.3.12_0: The seventh rule, the training rule on Mahānāma, is finished.
